trans-unit.source: Get started with Desired State Configuration (DSC) for Linux
trans-unit.target: Get started with Desired State Configuration (DSC) for Linux

trans-unit.source: This topic explains how to get started using PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) for Linux.
trans-unit.target: This topic explains how to get started using PowerShell Desired State Configuration (DSC) for Linux.

trans-unit.source: For general information about DSC, see <link><linkText>Get Started with Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For general information about DSC, see <link><linkText>Get Started with Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Supported Linux operation system versions
trans-unit.target: Supported Linux operation system versions

trans-unit.source: The following Linux operating system versions are supported for DSC for Linux.
trans-unit.target: The following Linux operating system versions are supported for DSC for Linux.

trans-unit.source: CentOS 5, 6, and 7 (x86/x64)
trans-unit.target: CentOS 5, 6, and 7 (x86/x64)

trans-unit.source: Debian GNU/Linux 6 and 7 (x86/x64)
trans-unit.target: Debian GNU/Linux 6 and 7 (x86/x64)

trans-unit.source: Oracle Linux 5, 6 and 7 (x86/x64)
trans-unit.target: Oracle Linux 5, 6 and 7 (x86/x64)

trans-unit.source: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 5, 6 and 7 (x86/x64)
trans-unit.target: Red Hat Enterprise Linux Server 5, 6 and 7 (x86/x64)

trans-unit.source: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 10, 11 and 12 (x86/x64)
trans-unit.target: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 10, 11 and 12 (x86/x64)

trans-unit.source: Ubuntu Server 12.04 LTS and 14.04 LTS (x86/x64)
trans-unit.target: Ubuntu Server 12.04 LTS and 14.04 LTS (x86/x64)

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the required ackage dependencies for DSC for Linux.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the required ackage dependencies for DSC for Linux.

trans-unit.target: Required package

trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.target: Minimum version

trans-unit.target: glibc

trans-unit.source: GNU Library
trans-unit.target: GNU Library

trans-unit.source: python
trans-unit.target: python

trans-unit.target: Python

trans-unit.target: omiserver

trans-unit.target: Open Management Infrastructure

trans-unit.target: openssl

trans-unit.target: OpenSSL Libraries

trans-unit.target: ctypes

trans-unit.target: Python CTypes library

trans-unit.target: Must match Python version

trans-unit.target: libcurl

trans-unit.source: cURL http client library
trans-unit.target: cURL http client library

trans-unit.source: Installing DSC for Linux
trans-unit.target: Installing DSC for Linux

trans-unit.source: You must install the <link><linkText>Open Management Infrastructure (OMI)</linkText><title></title></link> before installing DSC for Linux.
trans-unit.target: You must install the <link><linkText>Open Management Infrastructure (OMI)</linkText><title></title></link> before installing DSC for Linux.

trans-unit.source: Installing OMI
trans-unit.target: Installing OMI

trans-unit.source: Desired State Configuration for Linux requires the Open Management Infrastructure (OMI) CIM server, version 1.0.8.1.
trans-unit.target: Desired State Configuration for Linux requires the Open Management Infrastructure (OMI) CIM server, version 1.0.8.1.

trans-unit.source: OMI can be downloaded from The Open Group: <link><linkText>Open Management Infrastructure (OMI)</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: OMI can be downloaded from The Open Group: <link><linkText>Open Management Infrastructure (OMI)</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To install OMI, install the package that is appropriate for your Linux system (.rpm or .deb) and OpenSSL version (ssl_098 or ssl_100), and architecture (x64/x86).
trans-unit.target: To install OMI, install the package that is appropriate for your Linux system (.rpm or .deb) and OpenSSL version (ssl_098 or ssl_100), and architecture (x64/x86).

trans-unit.source: RPM packages are appropriate for CentOS, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, SUSE Linux Enterprise Server, and Oracle Linux.
trans-unit.target: RPM packages are appropriate for CentOS, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, SUSE Linux Enterprise Server, and Oracle Linux.

trans-unit.source: DEB packages are appropriate for Debian GNU/Linux and Ubuntu Server.
trans-unit.target: DEB packages are appropriate for Debian GNU/Linux and Ubuntu Server.

trans-unit.source: The ssl_098 packages are appropriate for computers with OpenSSL 0.9.8 installed while the ssl_100 packages are appropriate for computers with OpenSSL 1.0 installed.
trans-unit.target: The ssl_098 packages are appropriate for computers with OpenSSL 0.9.8 installed while the ssl_100 packages are appropriate for computers with OpenSSL 1.0 installed.

trans-unit.source: Note: To determine the installed OpenSSL version, run the command openssl version.
trans-unit.target: Note: To determine the installed OpenSSL version, run the command openssl version.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to install OMI on a CentOS 7 x64 system.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to install OMI on a CentOS 7 x64 system.

trans-unit.source: # sudo rpm -Uvh omiserver-1.0.8.ssl_100.rpm
trans-unit.target: # sudo rpm -Uvh omiserver-1.0.8.ssl_100.rpm

trans-unit.source: Installing DSC
trans-unit.target: Installing DSC

trans-unit.source: To install DSC, install the package that is appropriate for your Linux system (.rpm or .deb) and OpenSSL version (ssl_098 or ssl_100), and architecture (x64/x86).
trans-unit.target: To install DSC, install the package that is appropriate for your Linux system (.rpm or .deb) and OpenSSL version (ssl_098 or ssl_100), and architecture (x64/x86).

trans-unit.source: RPM packages are appropriate for CentOS, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, SUSE Linux Enterprise Server, and Oracle Linux.
trans-unit.target: RPM packages are appropriate for CentOS, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, SUSE Linux Enterprise Server, and Oracle Linux.

trans-unit.source: DEB packages are appropriate for Debian GNU/Linux and Ubuntu Server.
trans-unit.target: DEB packages are appropriate for Debian GNU/Linux and Ubuntu Server.

trans-unit.source: The ssl_098 packages are appropriate for computers with OpenSSL 0.9.8 installed while the ssl_100 packages are appropriate for computers with OpenSSL 1.0 installed.
trans-unit.target: The ssl_098 packages are appropriate for computers with OpenSSL 0.9.8 installed while the ssl_100 packages are appropriate for computers with OpenSSL 1.0 installed.

trans-unit.source: Note: To determine the installed OpenSSL version, run the command openssl version.
trans-unit.target: Note: To determine the installed OpenSSL version, run the command openssl version.

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to install DSC on a CentOS 7 x64 system.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to install DSC on a CentOS 7 x64 system.

trans-unit.source: # sudo rpm -Uvh dsc-1.0.0-254.ssl_100.x64.rpm
trans-unit.target: # sudo rpm -Uvh dsc-1.0.0-254.ssl_100.x64.rpm

trans-unit.source: Using DSC for Linux
trans-unit.target: Using DSC for Linux

trans-unit.source: The following sections explain how to create and run DSC configurations on Linux computers.
trans-unit.target: The following sections explain how to create and run DSC configurations on Linux computers.

trans-unit.source: Creating a configuration MOF document
trans-unit.target: Creating a configuration MOF document

trans-unit.source: The Windows PowerShell Configuration keyword is used to create a configuration for Linux computers, just like for Windows computers.
trans-unit.target: The Windows PowerShell Configuration keyword is used to create a configuration for Linux computers, just like for Windows computers.

trans-unit.source: The following steps describe the creation of a configuration document for a Linux computer using Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The following steps describe the creation of a configuration document for a Linux computer using Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Import the nx module.
trans-unit.target: Import the nx module.

trans-unit.source: The nx Windows PowerShell module contains the schema for Built-In resources for DSC for Linux, and must be installed to your local computer and imported in the configuration.
trans-unit.target: The nx Windows PowerShell module contains the schema for Built-In resources for DSC for Linux, and must be installed to your local computer and imported in the configuration.

trans-unit.source: -To install the nx module, copy the nx module directory to either %UserProfile%\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\ or C:\windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules.
trans-unit.target: -To install the nx module, copy the nx module directory to either %UserProfile%\Documents\WindowsPowerShell\Modules\ or C:\windows\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules.

trans-unit.source: The nx module is included in the DSC for Linux installation package (MSI).
trans-unit.target: The nx module is included in the DSC for Linux installation package (MSI).

trans-unit.source: To import the nx module in your configuration, use the Import-DSCResource command:
trans-unit.target: To import the nx module in your configuration, use the Import-DSCResource command:

trans-unit.source: Define a configuration and generate the configuration document:
trans-unit.target: Define a configuration and generate the configuration document:

trans-unit.source: Push the configuration to the Linux computer
trans-unit.target: Push the configuration to the Linux computer

trans-unit.source: Configuration documents (MOF files) can be pushed to the Linux computer using the <link><linkText>Start-DscConfiguration</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Configuration documents (MOF files) can be pushed to the Linux computer using the <link><linkText>Start-DscConfiguration</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: In order to use this cmdlet, along with the <link><linkText>Get-DscConfiguration</linkText><title></title></link>.aspx, or <link><linkText>Test-DscConfiguration</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlets, remotely to a Linux computer, you must use a CIMSession.
trans-unit.target: In order to use this cmdlet, along with the <link><linkText>Get-DscConfiguration</linkText><title></title></link>.aspx, or <link><linkText>Test-DscConfiguration</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlets, remotely to a Linux computer, you must use a CIMSession.

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>New-CimSession</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet is used to create a CIMSession to the Linux computer.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>New-CimSession</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet is used to create a CIMSession to the Linux computer.

trans-unit.source: The following code shows how to create a CIMSession for DSC for Linux.
trans-unit.target: The following code shows how to create a CIMSession for DSC for Linux.

trans-unit.source: Note:
trans-unit.target: Note:

trans-unit.source: For “Push” mode, the user credential must be the root user on the Linux computer.
trans-unit.target: For “Push” mode, the user credential must be the root user on the Linux computer.

trans-unit.source: Only SSL/TLS connections are supported for DSC for Linux, the New-CimSession must be used with the –UseSSL parameter set to $true.
trans-unit.target: Only SSL/TLS connections are supported for DSC for Linux, the New-CimSession must be used with the –UseSSL parameter set to $true.

trans-unit.source: The SSL certificate used by OMI (for DSC) is specified in the file: /opt/omi/etc/omiserver.conf with the properties: pemfile and keyfile.
trans-unit.target: The SSL certificate used by OMI (for DSC) is specified in the file: /opt/omi/etc/omiserver.conf with the properties: pemfile and keyfile.

trans-unit.source: If this certificate is not trusted by the Windows computer that you are running the New-CimSession cmdlet on, you can choose to ignore certificate validation with the CIMSession Options: -SkipCACheck:$true -SkipCNCheck:$true -SkipRevocationCheck:$true
trans-unit.target: If this certificate is not trusted by the Windows computer that you are running the New-CimSession cmdlet on, you can choose to ignore certificate validation with the CIMSession Options: -SkipCACheck:$true -SkipCNCheck:$true -SkipRevocationCheck:$true

trans-unit.source: Run the following command to push the DSC configuration to the Linux node.
trans-unit.target: Run the following command to push the DSC configuration to the Linux node.

trans-unit.source: Start-DSCConfiguration -Path:"C:\temp" -cimsession:$sess -wait -verbose
trans-unit.target: Start-DSCConfiguration -Path:"C:\temp" -cimsession:$sess -wait -verbose

trans-unit.source: Distribute the configuration with a pull server
trans-unit.target: Distribute the configuration with a pull server

trans-unit.source: Configurations can be distributed to a Linux computer with a pull server, just like for Windows computers.
trans-unit.target: Configurations can be distributed to a Linux computer with a pull server, just like for Windows computers.

trans-unit.source: For guidance on using a pull server, see <link><linkText>Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration Pull Servers</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For guidance on using a pull server, see <link><linkText>Windows PowerShell Desired State Configuration Pull Servers</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For additional information and limitations related to using Linux computers with a pull server, see the Release Notes for Desired State Configuration for Linux.
trans-unit.target: For additional information and limitations related to using Linux computers with a pull server, see the Release Notes for Desired State Configuration for Linux.

trans-unit.source: Working with configurations locally
trans-unit.target: Working with configurations locally

trans-unit.source: DSC for Linux includes scripts to work with configuration from the local Linux computer.
trans-unit.target: DSC for Linux includes scripts to work with configuration from the local Linux computer.

trans-unit.source: These scripts are locate in /opt/microsoft/dsc/Scripts and include the following:
trans-unit.target: These scripts are locate in /opt/microsoft/dsc/Scripts and include the following:

trans-unit.source: GetConfiguration.py
trans-unit.target: GetConfiguration.py

trans-unit.source: Returns the current configuration applied to the computer.
trans-unit.target: Returns the current configuration applied to the computer.

trans-unit.source: Similar to the Windows PowerShell cmdlet Get-DscConfiguration cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Similar to the Windows PowerShell cmdlet Get-DscConfiguration cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: # sudo ./GetConfiguration.py
trans-unit.target: # sudo ./GetConfiguration.py

trans-unit.source: GetMetaConfiguration.py
trans-unit.target: GetMetaConfiguration.py

trans-unit.source: Returns the current meta-configuration applied to the computer.
trans-unit.target: Returns the current meta-configuration applied to the computer.

trans-unit.source: Similar to the cmdlet <link><linkText>Get-DSCLocalConfigurationManager</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Similar to the cmdlet <link><linkText>Get-DSCLocalConfigurationManager</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: # sudo ./GetMetaConfiguration.py
trans-unit.target: # sudo ./GetMetaConfiguration.py

trans-unit.source: InstallModule.py
trans-unit.target: InstallModule.py

trans-unit.source: Installs a custom DSC resource module.
trans-unit.target: Installs a custom DSC resource module.

trans-unit.source: Requires the path to a .zip file containing the module shared object library and schema MOF files.
trans-unit.target: Requires the path to a .zip file containing the module shared object library and schema MOF files.

trans-unit.source: # sudo ./InstallModule.py /tmp/cnx_Resource.zip
trans-unit.target: # sudo ./InstallModule.py /tmp/cnx_Resource.zip

trans-unit.source: RemoveModule.py
trans-unit.target: RemoveModule.py

trans-unit.source: Removes a custom DSC resource module.
trans-unit.target: Removes a custom DSC resource module.

trans-unit.source: Requires the name of the module to remove.
trans-unit.target: Requires the name of the module to remove.

trans-unit.source: # sudo ./RemoveModule.py cnx_Resource
trans-unit.target: # sudo ./RemoveModule.py cnx_Resource

trans-unit.source: SendConfigurationApply.py
trans-unit.target: SendConfigurationApply.py

trans-unit.source: Applies a configuration MOF file to the computer.
trans-unit.target: Applies a configuration MOF file to the computer.

trans-unit.source: Similar to the <link><linkText>Start-DscConfiguration</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Similar to the <link><linkText>Start-DscConfiguration</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Requires the path to the configuration MOF to apply.
trans-unit.target: Requires the path to the configuration MOF to apply.

trans-unit.source: # sudo ./RemoveModule.py cnx_Resource
trans-unit.target: # sudo ./RemoveModule.py cnx_Resource

trans-unit.source: SendMetaConfiguration.py
trans-unit.target: SendMetaConfiguration.py

trans-unit.source: Applies a Meta Configuration MOF file to the computer.
trans-unit.target: Applies a Meta Configuration MOF file to the computer.

trans-unit.source: Similar to the <link><linkText>Set-DSCLocalConfigurationManager</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.
trans-unit.target: Similar to the <link><linkText>Set-DSCLocalConfigurationManager</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet.

trans-unit.source: Requires the path to the Meta Configuration MOF to apply.
trans-unit.target: Requires the path to the Meta Configuration MOF to apply.

trans-unit.source: # sudo ./SendMetaConfiguration.py –configurationmof /tmp/localhost.meta.mof
trans-unit.target: # sudo ./SendMetaConfiguration.py –configurationmof /tmp/localhost.meta.mof

trans-unit.source: PowerShell Desired State Configuration for Linux Log Files
trans-unit.target: PowerShell Desired State Configuration for Linux Log Files

trans-unit.source: The following log files are generated for DSC for Linux messages.
trans-unit.target: The following log files are generated for DSC for Linux messages.

trans-unit.source: Log file
trans-unit.target: Log file

trans-unit.source: Directory
trans-unit.target: Directory

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: omiserver.log
trans-unit.target: omiserver.log

trans-unit.source: /opt/omi/var/log/
trans-unit.target: /opt/omi/var/log/

trans-unit.source: Messages relating to the operation of the OMI CIM server.
trans-unit.target: Messages relating to the operation of the OMI CIM server.

trans-unit.source: dsc.log
trans-unit.target: dsc.log

trans-unit.source: /opt/omi/var/log/
trans-unit.target: /opt/omi/var/log/

trans-unit.source: Messages relating to the operation of the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) and DSC resource operations.
trans-unit.target: Messages relating to the operation of the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) and DSC resource operations.
